TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 982
TEI.2.document_recipient: Oliver Jones, F. Johnson, J. B. Miller, L. Lessassier, W. H. Jack, S.M. Williams
TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Oliver Jones, F. Johnson, J. B. Miller, L. Lessassier, W. H. Jack, S.M. Williams, 05-31-1833

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Oliver Jones et al., Matamoros, May 31, 1833. Advising support of George Fisher as customs collector.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: Copy by George Fisher in Lamar Papers, Texas State Library. The same letter went to Wyly Martin, of the "Fort Settlement, near San Felipe de Austin."
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 982

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Oliver Jones et al., Matamoros, May 31, 1833. Advising support of George Fisher as customs collector.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-31-1833">May 31. 1833*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*Messrs *person_mentioned*Oliver Jones*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*F. Johnson*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*J. B. Miller*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*L. Lessassier*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*W. H. Jack*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S.M. Williams*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Gentlemen: This will be handed to you by *person_mentioned*Mr. Geo: fisher*/person_mentioned* who returns as *person_mentioned*Collector of Galveston*/person_mentioned*, and I particularly recommend that all former excitements relative to any transactions in which *person_mentioned*Mr Fisher*/person_mentioned* may have been concerned, should be totally forgotten, and that he be sustained firmly in the discharge of his duties, as I have recommended in my letter to the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamiento*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
